text: in an ideal world we would wake up
naturally in the morning because we've
gotten enough sleep but unfortunately
oftentimes we we don't have that extra
amount of time to get all the sleep that
we would prefer so we need to have an
alarm to wake us up in the morning so a
lot of us we we want to hit that snooze
button in the morning because we really
don't want to get up and so people they
know that they don't have to get up
until 8 o'clock in the morning but they
set their alarm at 7:30 and then when
they wake up at 7:30 they all they'll
hit the snooze button and they know they
have three chances to hit that snooze
button again before they have to get up
at eight the problem with that is those
that can really cut down on the total
amount of sleep that you're able to get
we go through sleep cycles at last
perhaps 45 minutes or so and you're not
being able to get through that entire
cycle within that 10 15 minute duration
when you've after you've hit your snooze
button it's best to simply set the alarm
at the time when you really need to get
up and then get yourself up at that time
personally I put my alarm clock on the
other side of the room so I really do
have to get up to turn the thing off
because it'll drive me nuts if I don't
